intro: Sakersia strigosa, commonly known as the rough sakersia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Sakersia strigosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ease of care.
